content.text: Urinary tract infections (UTIs) are a common reason for outpatient visits and antibiotic prescriptions. They can be classified as uncomplicated or complicated.
Uncomplicated UTIs occur in healthy, premenopausal, non-pregnant women with no urologic abnormalities.
Complicated UTIs are those associated with factors that increase the risk of treatment failure, such as male sex, pregnancy, obstruction, or the presence of a urinary catheter.
